column4: all solutions are not working, i have tried using vlc and the camera is working alright, but with skype no, maybe i should try restarting my machine
i did
and the result of luvcview?
Then try this, luvcview -d /dev/video1
ok
ok
So, did you get the camera working?
Did it show your face?
If it work and it showed your face... Then I guess a restart would resolve back to /dev/video0 than /dev/video1
still not happening
After you run "luvcview -d /dev/video1" ... Did it show your face?
Why don't you run "ls /dev/video*" to see if you do have it there.
Nothing on /dev/video* ?
Ah, you do have it there.. So, how about try "luvcview -d video0" then smile for the result.
correct, not here on the irc.. on the terminal. :p
Can you give me the model of your camera?
Thanks, I'll google it and learn a bit mroe
Try follow each step here...
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Spca5xx#Step_1:_Get_the_spca5xx_source_code
For your camera... It would need spca5xx driver... So, this website should be the best to help solve your problem. Good luck.
I hope everything worked out for you. sacarlson can probably help you but ask anybody here with long experience on linux and camera.
